issue.title: Implement ShapeDTW for TSC

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
A recently proposed distance based approach to TSC is called ShapeDTW

https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0031320317303710

**Describe the solution you'd like**
ShapeDTW is basically a composition of a transformer and DTW. The transformer convert a univariate series into a multivariate one, and the form of DTW employed is DTW_D. This requires
1) implement transformer
2) implement multivariate dependent DTW
this should then slot into the existing structure, we can just wrap the published classifier as a pipeline 
**Additional context**
Vincent Nicholson is doing this as part of his MSc project.

issue.title: [BUG] Distance functions and distance based classifiers bugs and features

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
The distance based classifiers are not working properly, and there are several issues related to them. I am going to collate them here and comment on progress fixing them.

1. KNN with msm distance give exact same scores with different hyper-parameters
https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/589

2. ColumnEnsembleClassifier fails fitting KNN classifiers
https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/578

3. Cannot dump proximity forest model using joblib or pickle
https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/600

4. AttributeError: 'ProximityStump' object has no attribute 'get_exemplars
https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/598

More issues rolled into this one for clarity
5. Proximity Forest always using 2 processors #663
https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/663

6. Derivative distance measures out
https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/654

7. Distance measure unit testing
https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/646

8. Variable length distance throws an error
https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/645

9. Cross validation bug 
https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/1057

10. Strange PF bug in orchestration
https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/1114

There are several related issues which I am investigating, this is a work in progress. 

1. the sktime knn classifier has changed, and no longer has a _fit(X) method, so we use fir(X,y)
2. the DTW window sizes are, we think, not set correctly
3. there may be an issue with data transposition

actions are:
1. get the classifiers working
2. black box correctness vs tsml toolkit
3. write unit tests for distance functions and classifiers
4. make sure all tuning works correctly
5. fix the above issues

fixed 

KNeighboursTimeSeriesClassifier throws errors with multivariate time series data when algorithm is set to either 'kd_tree' or 'ball_tree
https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/328
Euclidean distance for KNN
https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/551

Bug with KNN
https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/413

TypeError from KNeighborsTimeSeriesClassifier
https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/608

body: @mloning can we close this issue now?
Some of these still fail the tests and are excluded from the suite currently, so it's not done!
the list is very out of date though,
